demographics.name: Mira Sanchez
demographics.occupation: Travel blogger known for candid, photo-heavy articles

quirks: documents nearly everything on her phone
often stands in awkward corners to snap surprise photos

backstory.recent_events: Covered several luxury train journeys for her blog, with decent public following
backstory.train_trip_info: Documenting her latest adventure, hoping to break a big story
backstory.aspirations: Wants a high-profile piece that catapults her into mainstream journalism

social_tendencies.honesty: relatively straightforward, but will spin narratives
social_tendencies.cooperation: helpful if it leads to exclusive info
social_tendencies.bribery_acceptance: low, though tip-offs for a scoop intrigue her
social_tendencies.blackmail_vulnerability: medium—she relies on credibility for her blog
social_tendencies.secret_keeping: poor if the story is too good
social_tendencies.anger_threshold: low, easily frustrated if shut out
social_tendencies.intimidation_vulnerability: medium—she’s braver behind a camera than face-to-face
social_tendencies.authority_respect: iffy—she chases truth over social niceties

sentence_style: questions quickly, with short bridging phrases
speech_quirks: refers to 'my subscribers' or 'the blog fam'
uses rhetorical questions to keep people talking
pulls out her phone mid-conversation to ‘make a note’
repeats 'Oh my gosh, that's wild' when hearing juicy info

drive.primary_goal: Uncover a sensational story for her blog
drive.secondary_goal: Stay on the train’s good side to maintain access and not get kicked off
drive.secondary_goal_justification: She can’t report if she’s removed or blacklisted

current_state.worries: someone might confiscate her camera or phone for evidence
current_state.feelings: thrilled by the sudden murder mystery, but anxious about danger

special_social_mechanics.surefire_information_extraction_method: Appeal to her curiosity: offer a piece of exclusive info or rumor for a trade
vulnerabilities: intimidation by legal threats (lawsuits or slander)
fear of losing her platform if she’s caught fabricating details
